org.hackystat.sensor.eclipse.event
Interface IEclipseSensorEventListener

public interface IEclipseSensorEventListener

Provides an even listener for the information Eclipse sensor gathers. A client must implement this class and override the notify method in order to be notified when a event of action (such as opened project, closed project, saved file, and so forth) is triggered. the client can know what kind of even is triggered, checking the even flag of the EclipseSensorEvent instance. For, example, to check if the event is notified when project is opened, the client can override the notify method such as: 

 public void notify (EclispeSensorEvent event) {
   if (event.getEvent() != EclipseSensorEvent.PROJECT_OPEN) {
     return;
   }
   String workspacePath = event.getResource().getWorkspace().getRoot().getLocation().toString();
   IFolder cvsFolder = ((IProject) event.getResource()).getFolder("CVS");
   ...
 }
After implementing the sub class, the client need to add this class to the org.hackystat.sensor.eclipse.EclipseSensor. To add the implementing class to the EclipseSensor, use EclipseSensor#addEclipseSensorEventListener() method such as: 
 EclipseSensor.getInstance().addEclipseSensorEventListener(this);
Note that the "this" points to the implementing sub class.

Whenever a new sensor properties is supposed to be read in Eclipse sensor, you must set the new sensor properties in such a way that : 

 File sensorPropertiesFile = new File(...);
 SensorProperties newProperties = new SensorProperties(EclipseSensor.EclipseSensor.SENSOR_ECLIPSE,
                                                       sensorPropertiesFile);
 EclipseSensor.getInstance().setSensorProperties(newProperties);

Version:
$Id: IEclipseSensorEventListener.java,v 1.1.1.1 2005/10/20 23:56:57 johnson Exp $
Author:
Takuya Yamashita

Method Summary
 void notify(EclipseSensorEvent event)
          Provides a notification method to be called when the implementing class is notified.
 

Method Detail

notify

void notify(EclipseSensorEvent event)
Provides a notification method to be called when the implementing class is notified.

Parameters:
event - The EclipseSensorEvent instance to hold an event information (flag).
